answer: **Answer:** Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was a Russian composer of the late 19th century. Known for his powerful, expressive music and his emotional and personal struggles, Tchaikovsky is regarded as one of the greatest composers in history. The Nutcracker and The Sleeping Beauty are among his most beloved and frequently performed works. Tchaikovsky is best known for his Russian classical music, which he merged with various European musical influences while retaining the distinct character of his homeland. Symphony No. 6
